line.en: 'Chomp chomp, chew chew... Seconds!'
'...Man, you eat a lot, don't you?'
'You can't fight on an empty stomach! Besides, if\neveryone spoke their minds, they'd say they're\nhungry.'
'You should eat up too, Ageha. Then we can take\nturns in the bath.'
'Okaaay!'
'Makes you nervous, doesn't it... Yoru?'
'Yeah. I can't believe it's really coming.'
'I'm no Isuka, but to be honest, I wasn't\nexpecting much.'
'I'm sure it's because they tried so hard. It's\nlike a reward for all their work.'
'There's nothing scientific about it. It's like a\nfairy tale.'
We were eating in a hurry after getting back from\nthe runway.
An omen appeared.
The Morning Glory. It was coming. The next\nmorning.
To get ready for it, everyone decided to go to\nbed early and get up before dawn.
'I'm done!'
'Me, too. Kotoriii, let's go to the baaath!'
'Heeey. Baaath, baaath tiiime.'
'I'm going, too!'
'Come with us, Amane!'
'I'll go later.'
'Should I wait until you're done eating?'
'No, that's okay. Go on ahead of me.'
'Hey, we're going, Kotori.'
Ageha pushes Kotori's wheelchair hard.
'Ah, hey, don't push\'
'(Let's give them some alone time.)'
'(Ah, right...)'
'Seee ya, Aoi.'
After winking at me, Ageha led Kotori and the\nothers out of the dining hall.
After everyone left, it got quiet very quickly.
Like she had forgotten about her usual lively way\nof eating food, she was eating very daintily.
'You don't like the food?'
'That's not it. It's really good.'
'It's just, there's so many things going on. My\nmind is so full...'
Amane looks troubled and sets down her\nchopsticks.
'Amane, your hand...'
'Mm? Oh, this? It's nothing.'
Amane had a scratch on the palm of her hand.
She probably got it when she grabbed the rock and\nused it to hit the wing.
'...Thanks back there, Aoi. For stopping me.'
'You stopped me from doing something I couldn't\ntake back.'
The wings that Amane had hit weren't hurt.
Although there were some scratches on the paint\non the front, there weren't any cracks.
According to Ageha, 'If Amane's weak little hits\ncould break it, there's no way it would be able\nto fly.
In addition to gliders, FRP is also the material\nused to make the hulls of fishing boats.
If it's made properly, it's not something that\nwould break so easily.
I sat next to Amane and held her scratched-up\nhands.
'Don't be so reckless, okay. Your hands have a\nlot of potential. They're really important\nhands.'
'Sure...'
Nodding, she rested her head against my chest.
'It's a good thing that letter appeared today...'
'Why's that?'
'If I had read it after Isuka had died, I\nwouldn't have been able to get back on my feet.'
'It's because it happened now that I can be this\nway.'
'Because you and everyone are here for me now.'
'Amane...'
I held Amane in my arms as gently as I could.
'Aoi, where are the bath towels? Heeey, Aoi...'
'What's up, Kotori? ...Ah.'
Kotori and Ageha, who had been peeking into the\ndining hall, stiffened straight up.
'E, excuse us! We'll be going, Kotori!'
'Y, yeah...!'
The two of them ran away all flustered.
'Hey, hey, they were holding each other! We\nreally saw something big there, didn't we!'
'Y, yeah! I guess when you're going out you\nreally do that sort of stuff!'
We could hear their excited voices from all the\nway down the hall.
'...They're definitely going to talk about it in\nthe bath, those two.'
'...I'm going to go in after them.'
That said, we actually were holding each other.
'Don't be so loud!'
It was still dark when we got up, so we were\ntrying to walk quietly to the runway.
'Brrr... It's cold.'
'Dawn really is chilly, isn't it.'
'That's also a characteristic of the Morning\nGlory.'
We sensed a sign of the Morning Glory in even the\ncold outside air.
'Quaaaack...'
'Hat, you woke up to come along, too?'
'Quack, quack.'
'Aoi, it looks like Hat wants to come with us.'
'It's fine as long as he doesn't get in the way,\nright?'
'Yeah. Hat, he said it's okay. But you've got to\nbe a good boy, okay?'
'Quack, quack.'
'Well then, let's goooo!'
'Wipe the moisture off first.'
The wet runway was surrounded by damp, thick air.
We brought all the towels and washcloths we had\nin the dorm and wiped down the surface of the\nglider.
'Wow, there's so much moisture.'
Even just lightly wiping it down made the towels\nheavy.
'Well, it got wet from the rain yesterday.'
'Oooh... that's my fault.'
'N, no way! Amane, don't get down on yourself.'
'That's right. We'll cover for your goof-ups. No\nmatter how many, Amane. Don't worry about it.'
'Quack, quack.'
'But, won't it take a long time to wipe this all\noff?'
'It doesn't need to be dry. We just need to get\nthe water off of the surface.'
'Even just that amounts to a lot of weight.\nThere's no way we can fly like that.'
'Oh, I see.'
Even with only a thin layer of moisture, I can\nfeel the weight surely being transferred to my\ntowel when I wipe it.
And that moisture was covering the entire body of\nthe huge aircraft.
For a glider flying in the sky, it's mass that\ncan't be ignored.
'I'm glad it's summer right now. In the winter it\nmight have frozen.'
'It could stop up the pilot tube or something.'
'Alright, that looks pretty good. Let's get\nstarted with the takeoff preparations!'
The pre-departure check work got underway with\nAgeha in the lead.
Today we'll double-check all the usual items.
Amane was watching all of this from a small\ndistance.
'What's wrong, Amane?'
She starts to look uneasy.
'...You aren't afraid to fly, are you?'
Amane shakes her head.
Then she peered up at me from below.
'...I wonder if I really can be moved?'
'I have a defect. I can't experience the same\nfeelings as other people, right?'
'When I think that I won't feel anything... it\nscares me.'
'Amane...'
Isuka promised to take Amane to the other side of\nthose clouds.
And apparently she said this.
...You'll definitely be moved!
For Amane, those words were part of the promise.
Amane looked uneasy during the final flight plan\ncheck yesterday.
Perhaps she was worrying about that then.
...What if even after reaching the other side she\nstill didn't feel anything...
She must have been thinking something like that.
That would mean the promise hadn't been\nfulfilled... that it really was a lie.
'You won't know that until you go.'
Amane was shocked, as though I had said something\nto brush her off.
But I quickly smiled.
'But I'm not worried. I mean, you always say the\nfood I make is so delicious.'
'Just like everyone else.'
'You're cooking really is good. That's obvious.'
Amane insisted, so I couldn't help but laugh.
'I don't think you have any defects. There's just\nsome things you don't understand.'
'...Things I don't understand?'
'Isuka taught you about many of them. That's why\nyou liked her, isn't it?'
'...Yeah.'
'Let's try to go there, to top of those clouds.\nThere's no point in fretting about it now.'
'...Okay.'
Looking a bit relieved, Amane nodded.
'Aoiii! Amaneee!! The cockpit, pleeease!'
'Got it!'
'Headed there now!'
Around the time the departure preparations were\nfinished, the sky was just starting to lighten\nup.
'I wonder if that's it...'
'I think I can see a faint silhouette...'
The sky is still dark.
Even if the clouds were out, you couldn't see\nthem with the naked eye.
'There was the sign and the wind is picking up.\nThere's no doubt about it.'
'Okay, let's fly! Places everyone!'
Everybody rushes to their places at Ageha's\ncommand.
Until Kotori and Asa take their places at the\nwinch, Yoru checks the tow line and connects it\nto the glider.
'There's just 45 minutes until dawn... We'll make\nit, right?'
'Yeah, it'll work out somehow.'
'Aoi... is it okay with me in the front?'
'Sure. It's easier to see there, right? It's your\ndestiny to fly beyond those clouds.'
'Ohh... It's easier to see, but it's scary...'
'Alright, close your eyes for a minute.'
'Hello, can you hear me? We're ready at the winch\nanytime.'
I could hear Kotori's voice through the radio.
'The tow line's connected!'
'Roger. Alright, here we go!'
'Aoi, I'm counting on you.'
Ageha spoke softly enough that only I could hear,\nand then closed the canopy.
The gusting wind was cut off and it suddenly\nturned quiet.
'Amane, just relax.'
'A, alright.'
Ageha lifted up the wing tips that were touching\nthe ground.
She looks our way for confirmation.
'Amane, are you ready?'
'Yeah, everything's fine.'
'Ageha, OKAY!'
I gave her the thumbs up as I shouted out.
When she saw that, Ageha gave me the thumbs up,\ntoo.
'RUNWAY IS CLEAR!'
'Kotori, raise it!'
At Ageha's signal, the winch started to move.
It pulls the aircraft harder and harder, speeding\nit up!
The wheels left the ground and our speed\nincreased even more.
'...Going up!'
'Whoooa... Aaah!'
I pulled back on the yoke and lifted the aircraft\nupward.
The glider took flight up toward the dawn sky.
At an altitude of around 300 meters, the glider\nbroke away from the tow line.
The wings caught the air and began to fly on\ntheir own.
'Whoaa!'
'Oh no! Are we getting rocked by the crosswind?!'
A violent, sudden gust of wind hit the side of\nthe aircraft.
I desperately grab the yoke and stabilize the\naircraft.
'Amane, you okay?'
'Y, yeah... I'm fine!'
It was likely an effect of the Morning Glory, but\nthe atmospheric conditions were incredibly rough.
However, because of that, if handled well, it was\npossible to gain a lot of height off of the\nstrong wind.
The night sky was pitch dark.
If I wasn't careful, I could've lost track of\nleft and right... or even up and down.
'Amane, could you take a look at the gauges for\nme?'
'Roger.'
When your vision isn't effective, you rely on the\ngauges.

By reading the gauges properly, it's possible to
grasp whether or not the aircraft is level, that
it's not dropping altitude suddenly, and that
it's not slipping sideways.
In extreme cases, even if the surroundings aren't\nvisible, it's still possible to fly.

I had to watch out for the crosswind and give my
full attention to piloting though. I'd have been
relieved if I Amane would watch the gauges as
well.
'Aoi, we're drifting to the east a little.'
'Roger.'
Our goal is Mt. Tsukubae. It's located behind the\nschool and to the north of Kazegaura.
I tilt the yoke to the left and step on the\npedal, correcting our flight path.
At the same time I checked the light on the\nground.
'That light over there... it's the convenience\nstore near my house. That must mean the lights\nstretching out over there are...'
Just for today, I had studied the locations of\nall the 24-hour sources of light and lined them\nup with a map.

Kazegaura has really changed. With all the
convenience stores, gasoline stands, billboards,
24 hour supermarkets, etc., it was pretty bright
even at this early hour.
Then, the lights that are going in almost a\nstraight line must be Main Street.
Streetlights line the roads heading toward Keifuu\nAcademy.
If we follow those lights, even if it's dark out,\nwe don't need to worry about going the wrong way.
With the lights on the ground as landmarks and\nrelying on our instruments, we aimed for Mt.\nTsukubae.
'Agehaaa!'
'Kotori, Asa... good work. You too, Hat... good\nwork.'
'How are Aoi and Amane?'
'They flew away safely. Shouldn't they be close\nto the school about now?'
'I wonder if they'll get there before dawn...'
'Even if the sun rises, the Morning Glory should\ntake a little while to show up. There should be\nplenty of time to get higher.'
'The real test starts after we get to Mt.\nTsukubae. I wonder if they'll be able to get in\nthe mountain wave...'
'...I'm worried.'
'What are you talking about? Aoi will work it out\nsomehow.'
'...I wonder. Do you think it's okay to leave it\nup to him?'
'You're putting a lot of trust in Aoi, aren't\nyou.'
'Well, nothing has ever gone wrong that I've left\nup to Aoi.'
'Quack, quack.'
'He may not look like it, but he can get the job\ndone, that Aoi.'
'You really trust each other, don't you... How\nwonderful!'
'...You didn't happen to have something in mind,\ndid you?'
'Hahaha, I wonder about that.'
'Aoi, take care of Amane for us!'
'Gaaa!'
'What the... Huh?!'
A sudden gust of wind thrusted us upwards. The\naircraft almost tipped over, but somehow I\nleveled us back out.
'W, what was that?!'
'The barometer is responding! It looks like we've\nentered the rotor wind!'
The glider lifted up.
We'd entered the updraft.
However, the updraft was unstable.
The glider rocked like a small boat floating in\nrough waters.
'Craaap... darn this wind!'
I grip the yoke and step on the rudder pedal,\ntrying to somehow manage the wind.
But...
'Wha!'
'W, whoa!'
Suddenly it feels like I'm floating.
We're falling!
The aircraft started to nosedive.
'We're in the downdraft!'
'I'll get us out!'
I circled the aircraft around and somehow got us\noutside of the current.
'Hah, hah, hah... That was close.'
'Phew... that was scary!'
I restored our position in airspace that had a\nstable air current.
Now we were below the mountain wave created by\nMt. Tsukubae.
I had attempted to move us into the rotor wind\nfrom there.
The rotor wind is the air current that is created\nbetween mountain waves.
In between the upward and downward flowing\nsections of mountain waves, the air spins like a\nrotor.
If you can get in the upward flowing side, there\nwill be an upward flowing mountain wave from\nthere on.

But, the air current is extremely violent and
unstable. Very close to the top of that upward
flowing air current is an equally powerful
downward flowing air current.
Unfortunately, we had just gone from the upward\nflowing air current to the downward flowing air\ncurrent.
'We lost quite a bit of altitude.'
'The next time we get caught up in the downdraft,\nwe're out...'
If we fall so low that we can't reach the rotor\nwind, it will be hard to get back here.
After all, even just getting into the rotor wind\nrequires quite a bit of technique.
Then to move from there into the mountain wave\nwas also quite difficult.
But,
'I got a feel for it back there. It's just like\nyour simulator!'

Just as you would expect, the simulator that
Amane made is top notch. Even though there may
not be any actual physical sensation, it felt
very close to the real thing.
It looked like all that time I spent practicing\non the computer was going to come in handy.
'I'm going again!'
'Okay.'
I reversed the aircraft's course and headed to\nwhere we just were.
I circle around the downdraft and look for the\nupdraft that should be just over there.
'Where... Where is it...'
'Whoa!'
The aircraft shook unnaturally.
The edge of the left wing was hit by the updraft.
'I found it!'
I tilted the yoke to the left and flew us into\nthe invisible pillar of air.
All of the sudden our aircraft was lifted up.
The aircraft rises up and up and I feel the\nvertical g-force affecting my body.
The barometer is slow to respond.
'Looks like we're in it!'
'Alright!'
I circled around with the aircraft, taking care\nnot to fly us back into the downdraft.
But the rotor wind updraft isn't very steady.
It's difficult to stabilize the aircraft in that.
'Craaap... Darn this...!!'
I held on to the yoke like I was riding a wild\nhorse.
Although the ride is extremely uncomfortable, the\nglider continues to ascend rapidly.
'Aoi, over there...'
Amane was looking up from the cockpit of the\nbusily shaking glider.
The sky was glimmering faintly.
Dawn is near.
Then the silhouette of an enormous line appeared\nout of that faintly glimmering sky.
A pitch black band that cut across the sky,\nsplitting it in two.
'Morning Glory...'
'Yeah...'
It was so huge that I lost my sense of\nperception.
It was beyond my imagination.
'We're aiming for that...!'
Even after coming all this way, I felt like this\nwas a ridiculous challenge.
But on the other hand, I also thought this.
...It's right before our eyes.
The shadow of that enormous cloud seemed like the\nsign of some oncoming calamity. With that ahead\nof us, an uneasy look came across Amane's face.
'Amane.'
'It's almost time. I'm going to take you over\nthere!'
'...Okay.'
The glider rode the violent and turbulent air,\nsoaring ever higher.
'Look at the silhouette in the sky!'
'What is that...'
'No way... They're that big...?'
'You can only see a part of it in the\npictures...'
'That's a Morning Glory...'
'Quaaack...'
'...That's much larger than the cloud we saw from\nthe hill last summer.'
'...Are they really going to go across on top of\nthose clouds?'
'...There's no more time until dawn.'
'Hello, hello, Aoi, can you hear me?'
'This is Aoi!'
'It's starting to get light here, where are you?'
'We're in the rotor wind now and climbing up. A\nlittle longer and... erg, we can ride the\nmountain wave!'
'All clear, right?'
'Yeah, somehow.'
'It's looks really rough...'
'Aoi, good luck!'
'Amane, Amane! Can you hear me? Look at the sky!\nThe sky!!'
'Yeah, I'm looking.'
'You can see it really well from here. It's a big\none...'
'You're going to start riding that now!'
'Yep.'
'Be sure to have a good time, alright. Tell me\nall about it later!'
'Alright, I got it.'
'Hehehe, you're so lucky, Amane!'
...It's almost time. I'm going to take you over\nthere!
We were still in turbulent air for a while after\nAoi said that.
The aircraft was shaking so badly, I felt like I\nwould get sick if we stayed any longer.
'Amane, are you okay?'
'Yeah, I'm fine...'
'Just a little longer, I think.'
The glider was gaining a lot of altitude in the\nrotor wind.
Just like Aoi said, we should reach the mountain\nwave before too long.
Just when I was thinking that, the aircraft's\nrate of climb dropped.
Since I was the one watching the gauges, I told\nAoi about it.
'Our rate of climb has dropped suddenly!'
'That means...'
'Yeah, we might have reached the top of the rotor\nwind.'
'Alright.'
Aoi checks the direction.
The updraft of the mountain wave is on the\nopposite side of the rotor wind.
'Transferring over! '
Aoi tilted the yoke and stepped on the pedal.
The aircraft began to turn.
We headed straight for a while when...
It suddenly got quiet all around us.
As if the air had stopped and gone completely\nstill.
And then...
'...The glider's climbing.'
'Looks like we're in! In the mountain wave!'
'Yeah...'
It's a totally silent world inside the mountain\nwave.
That and there's almost no vibration at all. It\ncarries the glider high into the sky.
'This lift is amazing... This is the first time\nI've experienced this.'
'Yeah... It's not scary at all. It's like we're\nfloating across the surface of a quiet lake.'
It was such a mysterious experience.
To be flying in the sky and have such a feeling.
In the meantime, the sky was getting brighter and\nbrighter.
The clouds we were aiming for were getting\ncloser.
That enormous silhouette had an odd presence,\nalmost as if it had been there since long ago.
It feels like I saw something terrifying in those\njet-black shadows, stretching far out of sight.
The glider continues climbing in that direction.
'(I'm scared...)'
We're almost there...
To the promise I made with Isuka...
'(I'm scared... Isuka...)'
'The sky looks gray...?'
'It's not just the sky... the whole world does.'
'Are your eyes bad...?'
'No. They can perceive color. But, I don't feel\nit. Nothing but monotone.'
'Ever since meeting you, that's been changing\nlittle by little.'
'I'm starting to be able to feel small bits of\nlight shining through here and there.'
'Hmmm...'
Isuka looked like she didn't quite understand\nwhat I was saying.
I think that was the first time I told her about\nthat.
No one had ever understood when I told them. They\nwould just look at me with a strange look in\ntheir eyes.
That's why I hesitated to open up about it to\nIsuka.
Isuka's reaction was different than what I was\nexpecting, so I secretly felt dejected.
'...If I stay with you, I wonder if one day I'll\nbe able to feel how blue the sky is, too?'
'Mm? You're so silly, Amane.'
'Do you think the sky is always the same blue?'
'It's not? The sky is blue, right?'
'There's no way it could be.'
'Just take a look. Even now it's shifting.'
'...Shifting.'
'It starts with dawn, the sun rises, sunset\nspreads, night falls, and then until morning\ncomes again...'
'The sun sets, the clouds drift... It gets\novercast, it rains and snows...'
'The sky isn't the same sky, even for one\nsecond.'
'Isn't that how the color of the sky is?'
'The color of the sky...'
Hearing Isuka say that, I look up again at the\nsky. The endless sky above my head is suddenly\ntinged with a faint shade of blue.
However, there were no two parts that were the\nsame blue.
Deep blue, light blue, between the white clouds\nthe sky was colored with gently sloping\ngradations, shifting moment by moment.
That was the first time in my life that I had\never noticed the color of the sky.
'Pretty wasn't it, that picture?'
'Yeah...'
'I've never seen a sky with such vivid colors\nbefore.'
'I want to fly in that sky.'
'I want to be surrounded by that light...'
'...The two of us, together.'
'Isuka...'
I stood shoulder-to-shoulder with my friend and\nlooked up at the same sky.
Compared to hers, I'm sure my sky still lacks\ncolor.
Even if I were to stand in the same place, I\nstill couldn't see the sky that she would see.
But, I was able to empathize with her just a\nlittle bit.
With her desire to fly in the sky.
That was the first time I could empathize with\nIsuka, since that day when she found the\nabandoned glider.
Then I had a premonition.
... If we are able to fly the Morning Glory\ntogether, I might be able to see it. To see\nIsuka's sky.
That premonition made my heart race. From that\nday on, I started to look up at the sky a lot.
'Amane? ...What's wrong, Amane?!'
'Huh? ...Oh, I'm okay. I was just staring at the\nsky.'
Aoi's voice brought me back from my memory.
We were in mid-flight.
'I'm going to take us up a little bit more!'
'Okay, roger that.'
The mountain wave forcefully picked us up. It\nseemed like it would take us to a point where we\ncould finally look down on the Morning Glory.
I was looking at the clouds.
The sky was still dimly lit.
There's almost nothing that resembles color.
Dark, here and there gray. The black shadows of\nthe clouds stretched out, as though they were cut\nout from the sky.
That day... since the day that Isuka left, my\nworld turned monotone again.
It may have been little by little, but by meeting\nAoi and the others, the blueness of the sky\nreturned.
I also felt a premonition. That Isuka just might\nbe able to see the sight she had been wanting to\nsee.

Last summer, on the last flight with Aoi, when I
saw those clouds up close... even though I was
amazed by their brilliance, at the same time I
felt a very strong loss of hope.
I thought, 'This is wrong.
This isn't what Isuka wanted to see.
With that loss of hope, the sky grew dull.
Unexpectedly, a hand from the back seat gripped\nmy shoulder.
'Amane, you're shaking.'
I noticed it after he told me.
It seems like I was shaking.
'What's the matter?'
'...I'm afraid, of going over there.'
'Afraid...?'
That was a lie.
Afraid...
I'm just a normal girl who does things a little\ndifferently than other people.
Hopelessly, afraid...
I deceived you by holding on to a dream I didn't\neven believe in.
It was hard, Amane.
...To know the truth.
I want to be near you. I want to be your friend.
I'm a cowardly liar.
'And of Isuka...'
'And of myself...'
Please, forget about me.
I'm sorry, Amane...
I'm afraid to know.
'Aoi... I don't want to go any farth\'
'Get a grip on yourself!'
'Aren't you going to prove that Isuka isn't a\nliar!'
'B, but... we just proved that, Isuka isn't...'
'When Isuka wrote that letter, she must have been\nhaving a rough time.'
'If she had to leave anyway, she wanted to stay\nfriends with you. I'm sure that's what she\nthought.'
'But she left that letter behind.'
'Why do you think that is?'
The reason Isuka left that letter...
'So she wouldn't get in the way of your future\nanymore than she already had, she left... isn't\nthat what it said?'
'...Yeah.'
'But I don't think that was the only reason.'
'She must've been unsure, right... About whether\nor not she was fit to be your friend.'
'Whether or not she was fit to be my friend...?'

'Isuka thought she had been deceiving you the
whole time. If she really liked you and wanted to
be your friend, that must have been really hard
for her.'
'Because it would have been a false\nrelationship.'
'If her lie were discovered, she might lose your\nfriendship...'
'But I would never...'
Could I say never for sure?
In reality, that lie shook me up this much\nalready.
'But I'm the one who drove her to tell that lie.'
I called Isuka a 'genius' and treated her like\nsome sort of prophet.
By trying to live up to my expectations, she held\nup a dream that even she didn't believe in.
'Here's what I think. I think Isuka wanted to be\nyour best friend.'
'What do you mean?'
To tell the truth, Isuka is the one who tried to\npush me away.
'That's what An-chan was saying. As long as she\ncould help it, Isuka didn't want you to realize\nthat she had a weak body.'
'She wanted be your friend on equal terms, to the\nbitter end.'
To be sure, Isuka was trying to hide something\nabout her health.
She didn't want me to know about that.
'Feeling indebted to you because she told that\nlie, it must have been quite a burden for Isuka.'
'If she wanted to be your friend, she had to be\nhonest with you.'
'Then, that letter...'
'After telling you the truth, she couldn't then\nsay, "I want to be your friend.'''
'But if she just left without telling you, Isuka\nherself wouldn't be able to think of you as her\nbest friend.'
'So Isuka still thinks of me as...'
'Yes, she definitely thinks of you as her best\nfriend.'
'... If not, she wouldn't have left the picture\nof the glider in her room at the care facility,\nright.'
'How about you, Amane? '
'How do you feel about Isuka? '
'...Even now, she's still my best friend.'
'I wanted to be like Isuka, so I aimed for the\nsky. That feeling hasn't changed even now...'
'Well then, let's go.'
At the same time as saying that, Aoi reversed\ncourse with the glider and we shot out from the\nmountain wave!
The forward swept wing caught the wind and we\ndescend.
The shadows of the black clouds were already\nright below our eyes.
I pointed the nose of the glider in that\ndirection.
We were pretty high up.
The landscape below stretched far and wide and\nthe city lights shone faintly.
Just a pitch black, immense darkness spreading\nout everywhere.
It was a sight I was quite used to by now, a\nmonotone sight.
A world without color.
Just when I was thinking that...
A ray of light pierced through from the eastern\nsky.
The sunrise.
'It's dawn...'
All of a sudden sunlight rose upon the world,
causing the corridor of the sky to appear.
'Amaaazing...'
I could hear Aoi's innocent voice from the back\nseat.
I couldn't say anything, so I just nodded.
The passage of clouds glistened a golden yellow\nas the newly risen morning sun shone on them.
'...Color is being born into the world.'
Along with the start of a new day, the world\nbegan to shine.
'We'll get there in just a little bit. We can\nmake it, Amane!'
Heading toward the passage of clouds, the glider\ndescended gently.
'Whooooa...'
'How pretty...'
'Yeah...'
'Quack...'
'So that's a real Morning Glory...'
'Amazing, isn't it... It's overwhelming...'
'It's completely different than the clouds we saw\nlast summer. It's really pretty...'
'...Are Aoi and the others already over there?'
'Oh right... Aoi, Aoi, can you hear me? '
'This is Aoi. I can hear you.'
'How is it over there? Going well? '
'Yeah... We've just got on the Morning Glory\nnow!'
'Aha!'
'Great!'
'Roger. Well... take your time and have fun.'
'Right, roger.'
'Hehe, he said they're already there.'
'Where at? I wonder if we can see them?'
'Quaaaack.'
'They're above the clouds, so we probably can't\nsee them from below, right?'
'... Maaan, I want to try flying sometime, too.'
'We need to get a pilot's license. Each. One. Of.\nUs.'
'Yeah!'
The glider we were riding in was flying above the\nMorning Glory.
Riding the updraft of the rotating air current,\nwe pass through the passage of clouds.
'It looks just like a road made out of light...'
Lit by the morning sun, the clouds below looked\nalmost as if they were shining all by themselves.
That sight was, how can I say, very...
'Beautiful...'
The word just flowed out of my mouth. I even\nsurprised myself.
'...I see, so this is what 'beautiful' is.'
I had never fully understood just what that word\nmeant.
So I don't think I had used it very much.
Surrendering to my feelings now, that word\nnaturally came out.
After that, I gazed out at the landscape as far\nas I could see.
The panorama of the sky, dyed by the sunrise.
The morning sun rising in the horizon.
The clouds shining a golden yellow between the\nrays of light.
And then, the lake spreading out below and the\nstreets of Kazegaura.
'So the world was this beautiful...'
I felt like I had all of a sudden solved the\ntruth of the world.
This was the place Isuka had wanted to come to.
Isuka's sky.
This view is her world.
'Isuka, I knew you were a genius after all...'
Surrounded by the brilliant sky, those words came\nout naturally.
'I wonder where Aoi and the others are now.'
'I bet they're probably pretty far away by now.'
'They're so lucky! It's too bad we can't fit\neveryone in the glider!'
'Then we could take Hat with us, too!'
'Quack, quack!'
'Well, if we really wanted to, we probably\ncould've put him in there... just him though.'
'Well, we don't know when the next Morning Glory\nwill come.'
'But when it does, you should fly then.'
'Hehe, that's right. It's not like today is the\nend.'
'I wonder if it will appear again before Yoru and\nI graduate.'
'Maybe if you repeat the same year several times,\nlike you know who.'
'Might have to...'
'Hmm? I got an email. Who could it be from at\nthis hour?'
'W, what's wrong, Ageha?'
'Quack??'
'Oh no, I need to tell Aoi about this soon.'
I crossed above the Morning Glory, while making\nsure not to leave the updraft.
This cloud was like a miracle to gliders.
Because as long as it's here, you won't lose\naltitude and can go anywhere in the sky that you\nwant.
And, there's this view.
360 degrees of the dawn sky.
It's just like seeing a dream.
For a while now, Amane had been completely\nabsorbed in looking at the scenery.
'How is it, Amane?'
'Yeah...'
'...What Isuka said, she was right.'
'So, you're impressed, huh?'
I asked Amane jokingly, and she giggled in\nresponse.
'I always thought that I didn't have it in me to\nthink anything was 'beautiful.''
'But I do...'
'Isuka wasn't a liar.'
'...Nope.'
'The world is filled with so many colors. But\nwithout light, they can't be given life.'
'Because all colors are just that... light.'
Color comes to life through the reflection of\nlight.
All matter has an inherent reflectivity. Light is\nmade up of components that are absorbed and parts\nthat are reflected.
What gets reflected appears as color to our eyes.
That's why if there's no light, colors don't\nexist.
'Isuka is like my light.'
'With her each and every word, she lit up my\nworld, she gave me color...'
'Without a doubt, Isuka is... even now to me...'
Amane's voice suddenly becomes mixed with tears.
'What's wrong?'
'Really, the person I was supposed to see this\nwith isn't here. That's so... sad...'
'Amane...'
The promise had been fulfilled.
But because of that, it must have brought up a\nlot of emotions.
Amane lowered her head and continued crying.
'...We should head back soon.'
We had flown quite a large distance on the\nMorning Glory.
I wanted to continue flying like this until the\nclouds cut off, but we couldn't do that.
After all, there might not necessarily have been\na place we could land at that point.

Even if there were, it would be hard to get
things back to the garage. And if there weren't,
it could possibly lead to an accident. So I'd
like to avoid that as much as possible.
We needed to get back to the runway before much\nlonger.
After seeing Amane nod her head, I took us away\nfrom the Morning Glory.
'...See you later. The next time you show up,\nwe'll definitely come.'
As I said those words,
'Aoi! Aoooi, can you hear me?!!'
Ageha's voice rang out through the wireless\nradio.
She seems to be panicking about something.
'This is Aoi. I can hear you. What's wrong?'
'Where are you now?'
'Uuum... we're near an island. I was just\nthinking about heading back.'
This huge lake is dotted with islands.
'Perfect!'
'What is it, did something happen?'
'On your way back can you fly over Big Ripple\nBridge?'
'...Yeah, I can, but...'
'Alright, do that! An-chan is waiting for you\nthere!'
'An-chan is...?'
I was a bit skeptical, but I followed Ageha's\ninstructions.
I dove beneath the Morning Glory and headed\ntoward Big Ripple Bridge.
Big Ripple Bridge is the really long bridge that\ncrosses this huge lake.
It looks just like a wave connecting the islands\nthat dot the middle of this lake.
It's well known not only for the beauty of that\nview, but also because it is a shortcut to Tokyo.
'It's coming into view. Big Ripple Bridge.'
With dawn just beginning, there were almost no\ncars on the bridge.
'She said An-chan was here, but...'
I fly around and try to find something that looks\nhim, but from this height I can't make out much.
'Should we go a little lower?'
I dropped our altitude and got closer to the\nbridge.
'I think he'll come through here soon.'
'...Huh? Is that him?'
'Heeey, Aoiiii!!'
Near the entrance of the bridge, I could barely\nmake out a small, parked truck.
The silhouette next to it, that must be An-chan.
And then, next to him...
'Who is that, there's a girl.'
She was so small it was hard to see, but she\ndidn't seem to be someone I knew.
Amane suddenly opened her eyes wide.
Then, with her hand on the canopy, she stared at\nthe girl.
'Aoi, can't you get any lower?'
'I'm trying.'
I got us as low as possible while still leaving\nenough altitude to get back to the runway.
'...Isuka.'
'Huh?'
'I knew it... it's Isuka!!'
'...Amane is in, that?'
'Yep, she's riding it. Aoi is the one who's\npiloting.'
'Is that who you were talking about... The kid\nwho's like your brother...?'
'Yeah.'
'So, the glider was finished, huh.'
'Those guys built it based on the design plans\nthat Amane left behind.'
'They've inherited it like a tradition, it's so\nstupid and absurd.'
'I see...'
'I wonder if I can get through on the phone.'
Ring ring ring... ring ring ring...
'...Hello?'
'Hello, Amane? It's me, Tatsuya.'
'Tatsuya... who's that girl next to you?'
'It's Isuka.'
'I insisted she come here.'
'I'll put her on.'
'...Is this Isuka?'
'Amaneee...'
'Isuka...'
'You flew it, huh. Our glider...'
'Yep, I flew it. But I couldn't do it on my own.\nAoi and the rest let me fly it.'
'Taking care of your juniors... That's not like\nyou.'
'What are you talking about... You're the one who\nbrought them here.'
'Me?'
'Yeah. They read the flight log you left behind\nand then... they came, to the garage.'
'I understood your feelings. A girl named Kotori\nhelped us understand them.'
'Is that... so...'
'How was it, the view from above the clouds?'
'...It was just like you said.'
'I was moved. No, I couldn't help but be moved.'
'Your sky was beautiful.'
'I see...'
'I wanted to see it together with you...'
'I did see it, from here. Not from the sky\nthough...'
'But, we saw it together. I saw the same sky as\nyou.'
'Because... we promised.'
'...Yeah. You weren't lying.'
'I knew that all along, right from the\nbeginning.'
'Hehe... Don't get ahead of yourself.'
'Thank you, Isuka. For leading me here.'
'Thank you, Amane. For believing in our promise.'
'Amane, I think this is about our limit!'
'O, okay, I understand.'
'Isuka, we've got to get headed back to the\nrunway.'
'Can we... see each other again?'
Amane nervously asked into her cell phone.
Then, with a look of relief, she smiled. From\nthat, I knew Isuka's answer.
From the bridge, An-chan motioned with his hand\ntoward Kazegaura.
'(It must mean that An-chan and the others will\nhead to the runway, too.)'
Understanding that, I stopped cycling and headed\nback toward the runway.
'...Thank you, Igarashi.'
'I said it's fine. More than that, it looks like\nthose guys are heading back.'
'Let's go too.'
'Let me stay here just a little bit longer.'
'Mm? Alright, I guess...'
'I want to see.'
'Where that glider flew in this pretty sky...'
'Because it's the wings of our dream...'
